column13: Can follow other users maps and visualize them on the same home map. Users can make posts with or without location and add them to their own maps or maps they follow. Users can call on collaborators when they configure their map (unclear what collaborators do).Posts can be shared on Facebook, Twitter, etc. and can be embedded.
column14: Y ( comprehensive API with same functionality as front end website has access to)
column17: Decentralized. Site does not aggregate all posts to one visualization. Individuals control their  own posts and can make custom maps to share. Users can search for Maps by keywords or through hashtags. Eventually will be able to search for posts by user.
column18: Video, images, text with option to include location
column21: PHP, all data accessible through mySQL DB
column26: May request removal of personal information from system. Deleting posts as user does not remove them from Ushahidi's database.
column28: Location focused, can make incomplete posts and add comment/content later. â€œUsers can drop quick notes that represent data point and enter details later. Allows users to create ad-hoc check-in communities, complete with mobile apps and web portals. Crowdmap:CI focuses on simplfying annotated location points.â€ù "Has the ability to make notes/check-ins private. You can deploy the service within a crisis and/or particular group, so data you share doesn't necessarily have to go to others.â€ù â€œa private post not posted to any maps is only viewable by the post owner. A private post posted to a map is viewable by any owner and collaborators of that particular map.â€ù(https://wiki.ushahidi.com/display/WIKI/Crowdmap+-+Your+Posts)
